meanings.definition: Make a sharp sibilant sound as of the letter s.
meanings.sent1: The snake hisses when it feels threatened.
meanings.sent2: The kettle hisses as it boils on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child hisses like a snake to scare his little sister.
meanings.sent4: The wind hisses through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The angry cat hisses loudly, warning everyone to stay away.

meanings.definition: Express disapproval or contempt by making a sibilant sound.
meanings.sent1: The audience hisses at the terrible performance on stage.
meanings.sent2: She hisses in disapproval when she hears the gossip about her friend.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man hisses at the noisy neighbors to keep it down.
meanings.sent4: The kettle hisses in protest as it boils dry on the stove.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hisses at the students to be quiet during the exam.
